{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-124-19-B |Item_parent=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330) |Item_parent_short=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330) |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the short, medium and long-term effects of untreated age-related androgen deficiency. |Description=None |Rubric=Physiopathology |Contributors=Benjamin Pradere |Order=19}} The effects of DALA can be relatively unpredictable. == Nevertheless, the first short-term symptoms of ALAD are most often marked by : == * sexual problems: erectile dysfunction, reduced libido and even reduced quality of orgasm. * mood disorders with irritability * sleep disorders * vasomotor disorders (hypersudation, hot flushes) usually appear concomitantly
. == Secondarily, in the medium term, there may be: == * appearance or worsening of obesity (or metabolic syndrome [[Cardiovascular risk factors and prevention|222]]) with no direct link to a nutritional disorder, and more particularly gynaecological symptoms (reduced hairiness with skin atrophy, non-painful gynaecomastia) are frequent. * increased cardiovascular risk, particularly thromboembolic risk, especially in very severe forms. * neuropsychological disorders, which are rarer and usually appear secondarily: loss of memory and attention, or even mood disorders. == Finally, in the long term, the following may occur: == * signs of osteoporosis [[Definition of ageing|123]], [[Know the definition of osteoporosis (densitometry and fractures)|128]] (recent fracture, loss of height), suggestive of the diagnosis * and sarcopenia (muscular atrophy, reduced muscle strength), which should suggest the diagnosis.

question.question: What are the long-term effects of untreated age-related androgen deficiency?
